p: Peptides are organic polymers made of amino acid monomers in which the alpha amino group (-NH) of one acid is linked to the alpha carboxylic acid group (-CO 2H) of another through an amide bond. Peptides that contain more than 100 amino acid monomers are called proteins. Peptides have been isolated from roots, seeds, flowers, stems, and leaves of plants (Nawrot et al., 2014).
